text: MTb induces <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression and knockdown of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> impairs HIV-1 replication during MTb co-infection .
( A ) MTb but not HIV-1 increases <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA synthesis in human macrophages .
MDM were isolated from PBMC obtained from four normal donors .
The cells were incubated for 24 or 48 hours with heat - inactivated or live R5-tropic HIV-1 subtype B , C , or E isolates , live MTb strain CDC1551 ( 1 : 1 MDM : bacilli ) , or left untreated .

Quantitative real-time PCR analysis of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expression levels revealed that the low , constitutively present level of <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA expressed in untreated cells was not affected by exposure to live or inactivated HIV-1 , but was significantly increased at both 24 ( * , p < 0.05 ) and 48 ( ** , p < 0.01 ) hours following infection with MTb .

( B ) <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific siRNA effectively suppresses <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in MDM in both the absence and presence of MTb co-infection .

MDM ( 1x106 cells / well in a 6-well plate ) from four normal donors were transfected with siRNA specific for <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> or , as a control , <extra_id_0> GFP <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and were then infected with MTb ( 1 : 1 MDM : bacilli ) or left uninfected .
In the cells transfected with control siRNA , MTb infection significantly increased <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression in comparison to uninfected cells ( open bars ) .

When MDM were transfected with <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific siRNA , both constitutively expressed ( p = 0.048 ) and MTb - induced ( p = 0.021 ) <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA were significantly suppressed ( grey bars ) .
( C ) HIV-1 subtype B replication is significantly suppressed in the presence of MTb co-infection when <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression is abrogated in human MDM .
MDM from four normal donors were transfected with <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific and control siRNAs as described in 2B .
Cells were then infected with HIV-1Lai / Bal - <extra_id_0> env <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> followed by co-infection with MTb CDC1551 .
Virus replication was measured at days 6 , 9 , and 12 post-infection .

At day 12 , virus replication was significantly reduced in cells transfected with <extra_id_0> NFAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - specific siRNA in comparison to cells transfected with control siRNA ( * , p < 0.05 ) .
We monitored the morphology of cells within the infected cultures and did not observe noticeable macrophage necrosis even at the final timepoint of viral harvest .
